alert.note: Alert for Quitman; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 8:22AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Randolph, Quitman and northwestern Terrell Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 822 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Buena Vista to 9 miles west of Lumpkin to near Hawkinsville. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Shellman, Parrott, Springvale Station, Wire Bridge, Pachitla, Peterson Hill, Coles, White House, Crossroads, Yeomans, Oakville, Chambliss, Hatcher, Morris, Brooksville, Benevolence, Springvale and Wades. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
